sentence.text: To further characterize CD164 as a potential biomarker for malignant CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells, CD164<sup>+</sup> and CD164<sup>-</sup>CD4<sup>+</sup> T cells isolated from patients with high-circulating tumor burden, B2 stage, and medium/low tumor burden, protein localization to cilium-B0 stage, were assessed for the expression of genes reported to differentiate SS from normal controls, and associated with malignancy and poor prognosis.
